meanings.definition: To interlace or intertwine (branches, vines, etc.) to form a hedge or arbor.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys pleaching the branches in her garden to create a beautiful hedge.
meanings.sent2: The gardener spent hours pleaching the vines together to make a sturdy arbor.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels watched in amusement as the humans tried pleaching the branches like they do.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts pleached together like intertwined branches, forming a complex web of ideas.
meanings.sent5: The art of pleaching requires patience and precision to achieve the desired result.

meanings.sent1: The pleaching of the branches was a time-consuming task but resulted in a beautiful hedge.
meanings.sent2: His skillful pleaching of the vines created a stunning arbor in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The children found joy in pretending to perform the pleaching of imaginary branches.
meanings.sent4: The pleaching of relationships can sometimes lead to stronger bonds between people.
meanings.sent5: The pleaching of memories in her mind formed a dense thicket of intertwined thoughts.
